feats.name: Ranger Dedication
feats.description: You become trained in Survival; if you were already trained in Survival, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice. You become trained in ranger class DC. You can use the Hunt Prey action.

feats.name: Hard to Fool
feats.description: Your experiences in the Shadow Plane have made you wary of deception. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against illusions and to Will saves against illusions and lies (such as a successful Lie action).

feats.name: Bargain Hunter
feats.description: You can scrounge, haggle, and maintain your equipment to stretch your money further. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Earn Income, to Crafting checks to Repair items, and to daily Subsistence checks. When purchasing items, you can spend downtime to reduce the price of the items by 10%. For each day of downtime you spend, you can apply this discount to one item whose base price is 10 gp or less.

feats.name: Charming Liar
feats.description: Your charm allows you to win over those you lie to. When you get a critical success using the Lie action, the target's attitude toward you improves by one step, as though you'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to Make an Impression. This works only once per conversation, and if you critically succeed against multiple targets using the same Lie, you choose one creature's attitude to improve.

feats.name: Dubious Knowledge
feats.description: You're a treasure trove of information, but not all of it comes from reputable sources. When you fail (but don't critically fail) a Recall Knowledge check using any skill, you learn a bit of true knowledge and a bit of erroneous knowledge, but you don't have any way to differentiate which is which.

feats.name: Quick Squeeze
feats.description: You Squeeze 5 feet per round (10 feet on a critical success), rather than 5 feet per minute (10 feet on a critical success).

feats.name: Diverse Lore
feats.description: You collect information from a wide variety of sources, letting you use your esoterica lore for a wider range of topics. You can use your esoterica lore to Recall Knowledge about any topic, though you still can't use it in place of a specific lore for a task that requires specialized training, such as Crafting.

feats.name: Familiar
feats.description: You make a pact with a creature that serves you and assists your spellcasting. You gain a familiar.

feats.name: Spell-Signature Reading
feats.description: Whenever any caster performs magic, no matter how meager, it creates a vibrant display of runes circling around an intricate glyph known as a spell signature. As a learned student of the arcane yourself, you know all too well what information can be gleaned from such runes, such as one's personality or skill level with magic. You learn if the creature is casting the spell as a spontaneous, prepared, or innate spellcaster, if they can cast spells from spell slots, and what attribute they use to cast spells. If a creature can cast a spell from multiple sources such as having innate spells and prepared spells both, you learn both.

inventory.name: Amulet Implement
inventory.description: A darkwood amulet carved with shadow symbols

inventory.name: Leather Armor
inventory.description: Light armor, +2 AC, +4 DEX Cap, -1 Check Penalty

inventory.name: Adventurer's Pack
inventory.description: Includes backpack, bedroll, 10 pieces of chalk, flint and steel, 50 feet of rope, 2 weeks' rations, soap, 5 torches, and a waterskin

inventory.name: Scroll of Comprehend Language
inventory.description: Allows comprehension of an unfamiliar language for 1 hour

inventory.name: Chalice Implement
inventory.description: An obsidian chalice with silver inlaid runes

inventory.name: Esoteric Tome
inventory.description: Contains notes on various creatures and their weaknesses

notes.title: Shadow Plane Research
notes.content: I've been collecting information about the intersection points between our world and the Shadow Plane. There seems to be a pattern to the locations where the veil is thinnest. Most align with ancient sites of occult significance.

notes.title: Amulet's Strange Behavior
notes.content: My amulet implement has been behaving oddly when near the northern temple ruins. The symbols glow with a faint purple light, and I've noticed shadows cast by it seem to move independently. Could be connected to the strange occurrences the villagers reported.

implements.name: Amulet
implements.benefit: You gain an item bonus to saving throws equal to the amulet's implement bonus.
implements.esoterica: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to sense magic and to Recall Knowledge about magical subjects.

implements.name: Chalice
implements.benefit: As an action, you can imbue the chalice with a concoction that you or an adjacent ally can drink. This grants temporary Hit Points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier that last for 10 minutes.
implements.esoterica: When you succeed at identifying a creature, you learn about any special characteristics of its physiology.

exploits.name: Personal Antithesis
exploits.description: You learn how to find and exploit a weakness in a specific creature. When you use Exploit Vulnerability against a creature you've identified with Recall Knowledge, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against that creature.

exploits.name: Shadow Shroud
exploits.description: You can manipulate shadows around yourself, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks and concealment against creatures more than 30 feet away from you in dim light or darkness.

thaumaturge.paradigm_description: You believe that many supernatural effects, including those that creatures create, are curses, whether they manifest as traditional curses, possessions, or simple maledictions. You know that using a creature's personal possessions against them lets you take advantage of the metaphysical connection between creature and possession.
